content.title: Ladli Laxmi Yojana
content.details: Ladli Lakshmi Yojana has been implemented in Madhya Pradesh with the objective of creating positive thinking in public towards the birth of girl child, improvement in sex ratio, improvement in educational level, health condition of girls and laying the foundation stone for their good future. Some families are financially weak and not able to give higher education to their daughters nor can they collect money for their marriage. The State government has started the Ladli Laxmi Yojana to provide financial assistance for the education and marriage of the daughter. This money can be used by the girl for her higher education or marriage and to promote the empowerment of women in the state.
benefits: An assurance certificate of Rs 1,43,000/- is issued by the government in the name of the girl child.

From the time of registration, Rs 6,000/- will be deposited in the Madhya Pradesh Ladli Laxmi Yojana Fund for five consecutive years, the total amount of Rs 30,000/- will be deposited in the name of the girl child.
To girl child taking admission in class 6th: Rs.2,000/-
To girl child taking admission in class 9th: Rs. 4,000/-
To girl child taking admission in class 11th: Rs. 6,000/-
To girl child taking admission in class 12th: Rs. 6,000/-

An incentive amount of Rs. 25,000/- in two equal instalments in the first and last year of the course after taking admission to a graduate or professional course (course duration minimum two years) after class 12th.

Final payment of Rs 1.00 lakh on completion of 21 years of age of the girl child, on appearing in class 12th examination and on the marriage of the girl child, after completing the age prescribed by the government.
eligibility: The girl child should be born on or after January 1, 2006.
The girl child should be registered in the local Anganwadi centre.
Parents should be natives of Madhya Pradesh.
Parents should not be income taxpayers.
Family planning has been adopted after the birth of the second child.
Parents who have two or less than two children, family planning has been adopted after the birth of the second child.

The girl child born from the first delivery will be given benefits without family planning but It is necessary for the mother/father to adopt family planning in order to get the benefit for the second girl child.
content.application_process: Applicants have to visit the official portal, click on 'Apply Now', provide the 'Self Declaration' and click on Proceed, enter the required Samagra ID of the Girl and family, provide the required details related to the Girl and her family, and submit.
documents_required: The family ID of the girl child.
Photo of the girl child with mother/father.
Family planning certificate (in case of second girl child).

faqs.question: In which year was the Ladli Lakshmi Yojana started?
What Are The Benefits Under The Scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial Assistance is provided to the girl child at different stages.

faqs.question: Is this scheme for all girl children?
faqs.answer: No, girls should be born on or after January 1, 2006.

faqs.question: Is this only for Madhya Pradesh State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Girl child's Parents should be natives of Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: Is boy child also get the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, benefits will be provided only to Girl Child.

faqs.question: What is the Financial eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: Parents should not be income taxpayers.

faqs.question: How many girl child can get the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Parents who have two or less than two children, family planning has been adopted after the birth of the second child.

faqs.question: How To Apply For The Scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants have to visit the official portal, click on 'Apply Now', provide the 'Self Declaration' and click on Proceed, enter the required Samagra ID of the Girl and family, provide the required details related to the Girl and her family, and submit.

faqs.question: What Documents Are Needed?
faqs.answer: Girl Child's Samagra ID, family ID of the girl child, photo of the girl child with mother/father, family planning certificate (in case of second girl child).
